lg.l: Making words appear that are not of the way, passion,
like the confusion of those who drank cleared toddy which completely upsets the works,
is it of a different fate? This is certainly
she who advanced so that the anklets on [her] little feet tinkled?
While loneliness creeps up that stays now, she with a beauty that has become vain being a beast,
even though she [still] breathes, being one without any food,
appearing in the streets like one who destroyed him who consumed the beauty of her shoulders that melts [away],
she will thus smile a smile, being one without any of her shame that [once] was in excess.
Being one without femininity she will cry, friend,
won’t we go near [and] listen to what happened to [her with] a bright forehead?
Who are these? Look at them who feel confusion, ah:
Are you really without [any] suitable fault? With a smile
they say that her passion is something that is in excess. That dark
new beauty is like a flower that fades. They will fall
once they ceased to be confused with the moon.
Swarming around just me, don’t come [and] look!
With the beauty of eyes, brows, shoulder [and] waist that have dissipated,
tresses that were dark, hanging down like a few clouds, [all] those
not knowing as the height of [their] prize as changed,
my heart was caught in the net of someone.
Him who assured [me] by swearing many vows,
him who embraced me, pulling at the middle of [my] breasts,
don’t I see the murderer who left [me]?
Even though seeing, would you know me? Gripping [your] rays
he will look back there, sun, my kinsman,
where ever he is please show [him to me]. If you don’t show [him]
what would you do to the sky?
Like the moon in the sky that repels the difficult darkness
you may appear in the water, sun. That way,
beware of being eaten by the frogs.
Searching the one who does not grant [his presence], for him whom I will take
let the day be ended, [your] many rays withering,
He who united [with me], holding on to the kites that do not fly
that roll [down] from [my] beautiful forearms without stopping,
did he traverse the wilderness of buffalos that are not milked?
Having acted with a propriety he does not have, won’t he remember this village?
If he is [here] without resisting, I will take him.
Not getting [him] I will ache. Showing him to me
you too are of the cruelty of the one with the shark banner,
oh king who does not experience(?), please take [it] on your palm-leaf.
O king who does not change, your evening too has come.
Let this pain cease [and] cool down.
Don’t let your arrow make the heart of that one desperate
If I see with my dimmed eyes that one who caused [my] prostration,
gently I will look [at him]. I will grasp [his] clothes that hang down.
If doubtfully he, not knowing me, lets go [of me],
I will quickly set up an uproar, saying
“let there be truth to him. Is he a robber?”
Don’t ask me, people of the village. Every day,
while being confused like those who drank toddy from an earthen vessel,
without relenting it joins with [my] life, the attachment
of him who caused the not closing of my kajal eyes.
I [my] eyes won’t close [for me] to see [him] in a dream,
if you, sun, don’t show [him to me] in reality,
I will beg for the arrow of Kāmaṉ, myself embracing [his] feet
so that he with mount the horse born from the palmyra tree [and] come.
[Her] shoulders became emaciated [and her] bangles loose.
Ah, mother and you all, look: the simple girl,
like in the union of the white male goose companionably
joined with its soft-gaited female, [of her with] bright forehead
the lover he is indeed. When thus seeing him come,
she forgot all [her] lowly misery, the foolish girl.
Bowing while [her] smile ceased [and] shame stood up in [her] body,
as a woman she joined [her] befitting bosom
to the chest of him with a good handsome chest among smiles.
